jobPostingInfo.title: Business Administrator I
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This fantastic opportunity is with the Mechanical Systems Engineering, Fabrication and Test Division! This meaningful group engages in research, technology development, and the creation of mechanical, thermal, propulsion, and electronic packaging systems with expertise that spans the full breath of mechanical fields and is applied from architectural concept development through operations.

As a Business Administrator I, you will be supporting the Electronic Manufacturing, Packaging, & Technical Services Section! We provide engineering services that include the following: fabrication of electronics (boards and cables/harnesses), microelectronic and photonic hardware; electronic packaging, manufacturing engineering and electronic hardware thermal/structural analysis; sophisticated electronic packaging engineering, technology development and process engineering; technical facilities management and cleanroom services/certification; custom measurement systems development and instrumentation services; calibration services, test equipment loan pool and metrology engineering, and technical inventory management, cryogenics services and Flight Hardware Logistics Program (FHLP).

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the Business Manager with a variety of activities including budget development and financial planning, analysis, and reporting oversight, workforce analysis, rewards and recognition, facilities, safety, and property management across the division.

  • Prepare monthly and/or quarterly scheduled and ad-hoc financial analyses, reports and data as requested by management for planning, performance reporting and forecasting.

  • Coordinate financial reporting activities for assigned service center and burden accounts.

  • Collaborate with customers to achieve business objectives and increase the efficiency of the organization while serving as a liaison on business-related issues.

  • Assist in developing, coordinating, and improving procedures and reporting within the organization to meet JPL’s administrative and business requirements.

  • Develop automated reports, dashboards, and business metrics.

  • Coordinate monthly and quarterly reporting activities across the section.

  • May act as liaison to other laboratory organizations, including representation of and participation on various committees.

  • Perform ad hoc duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related subject area with a minimum of 1 year related experience; Master’s degree in similar fields with a minimum of 0 years of related experience.

  • Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: budgeting, financial analysis, reporting, human resources, workforce planning, safety, property, or facility management.

  • Ability to present data findings in a clear and concise manner using graphics, tables, and high-level summarization.

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve issues independently.

  • A successful history of establishing trust with customers and working as a strong, collaborative business partner.

  • The ability to use tact and discretion when working with critical and confidential data.

  • Proficient skills in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook, etc.).

  • Plan, prioritize, multi-task and complete assignments with minimal direction.

  • We love excellent customer service, organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.

Preferred Skills:

  • Extensive understanding and wide application of standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in Business Administration, Financial Planning, Workforce Administration, Safety and Facility Management.

  • Wide breadth of knowledge of JPL policies, procedures, processes and financial systems.  

  • Proven experience with Oracle financials and requisition modules, as well as reporting tools such as Data Extractor, Workday, OBIEE Analytics, Institutional Budgeting Tool (IBT), Power BI and JPL web applications.

  • Knowledge of applicable Laboratory and/or NASA policies and procedures, and government regulations and exposure to JPL’s Institutional business processes and architecture.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
